description:
Hi B3LSITTER,

Thank you so much for your review!

As and avid watcher of ABC's the Bachelorette, Mike has had 15 seasons to prefect the art of showing a bachelorette party's a good time!

Please come back some time!

reviews.title: Fun day of food and info
text: Great food and information about this area. Skip breakfast before because the food is plentiful. Morgan was a great guide.

reviews.title: An unique and enjoyable place
text: This was a unique and enjoyable way to spend a Sunday in Toronto! You are introduced to seven restaurants by your tour guide Joseph, who is knowledgeable about the area, likeable, and genuine. In addition to tasting and experiencing the food, you learn about the restaurants' origins and how those histories are entwined with those of the surrounding neighbourhoods and the city. Going off the usual tourist track allows you to find hidden jewels that you would be very unlikely to find on your own and certainly not all in one afternoon. An intimate look into Toronto, which is energetic, friendly, and colourful. Additionally, it offers excellent value, especially with the current reduction. I heartily urge everyone to try this!

reviews.title: Great opportunity
text: It was a terrific opportunity to experience all that Kensington Market had to offer that Local Toronto Food Tours took us there. The guide kept us interested with anecdotes, tales, food, and new locations for people who love authentic cuisine to return again.

reviews.title: Mike was a kind,
text: This was a different and fun way to spend an afternoon in Toronto!  The tour guide Joseph, who is full of local knowledge, likable and authentic, introduces you to seven food places, where you don’t just taste and experience, but also learn the story behind them and how their story is interwoven with the history of the neighbourhoods and the city.  You get to go off the beaten touristy path and discover hidden gems that you are very unlikely to discover on your own, and definitely not all in the course of an afternoon.  A glimpse at Toronto from the inside - colourful, casual and vibrant.  It’s also a very good value, especially with the current discount. I happily recommend this to all!

reviews.title: Fun day sampling food
text: An excellent day with Joseph Landau as guide. We visited numerous restaurants sampling different cuisines.
He was very knowledgeable and informative about the delicious food that was presented to us including its origin and how it ended up in Toronto.

Joseph is a historian and was able to enlighten us on the architecture and the history of the buildings in the area as well as the people that lived in the area over the many years dating back to the 1800’s
A great tour. Highly recommended

reviews.title: Absolutely worth the time!!
text: Fantastic afternoon!  Joseph was a knowledgable and very entertaining guide.  He was friendly and social!  We thoroughly enjoyed every part of this tour from the general history of Kensington market and chinatown, to each food stop along the way!
it was a great introduction to life in the area and we will definitely feel more confident explore more on our own.
Sooooo much delicious food!!!

reviews.title: Absolutely amazing!
text: A group of us girls went on this food tour as a bachelorette party starter and Mike made it such a fun experience.

reviews.title: Kerry
text: On one of the coldest days of the year, Michael was thoughtful, knowledgeable and passionate.  He provided us with just the right amount of cool historical data, and mixed it all in with his own stories and experiences.

The food was fantastic as well.  It really left you quite satisfied but not uncomfortably full.  Every sample was so different from the last but equally delicious. We were there for a bachelorette and it was something really fun and different to do in the city.
Thanks for a great day.

reviews.title: Fantastic food and history experience with Alex
text: Alex was an excellent guide.  He was great at explaining the history of the area and taking us to places we would normally not have gone.  All the food was great but I would have to say the spicy noodles were my favorite.  Even though it was not a street art tour, Alex spent the time pointing out some spectacular street art to our son.
Would definitely use them again.
Cheers

reviews.title: Beyond Kensington Market tour - delicious, éducative and lots of fun!
text: The tour was amazing - even on a freezing winter day. Julia was energetic, warm and funny and not only gave us background stories of the target restaurants but also the history of interesting landmarks which was refreshingly informative. We were led to 7 different tasting stations spanning from dumplings, main course to dessert and cheese and most of the food were above usual delicious and iconic of the local neighborhoods culture. The exploring walk was easy, a lot of fun tasting and learning about Toronto - the culinary is just a reflective of the multiculturalism. Highly recommended!

reviews.title: Awesome tour even as a local!
text: This tour was a great Sunday spent. I am a local in Toronto and went with a girlfriend for something fun to do, it didn't disappoint. Alex, our guide, was super informative with lots of fun facts about Kensington/China Town, he also has great foodie suggestions.
Food was delicious, my favourite would have to be the dan dan noodles. A great amount of food that left us full but not feeling sick.

reviews.title: The best way to understand the history of a city and its population
text: I did not know what to expect and this is among the top tours (if not the top tour) I have ever taken in 31 countries. I was able to see how the growth and history of a city.  Mike is not just a tour guide, but an amazing history and sociology teacher.  His passion for the city,  the world as seen through food and the history of food,  made me wish i could do it again right away!  Thank you!  Every city I go to now,  i will try to find something similar.  Worth doing for sure!

reviews.title: Great way to see Kensington Market and beyond!
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our food/cultural tour of Chinatown and Kensington Market.  Fantastic food, right-size group, and a great tour guide in Julia.

reviews.title: Great Culture and Food Tour
text: Alex, our tour guide, is extremely knowledgeable about the food and cultural scenes in Toronto, which enhanced our tour immensely. He’s personable, funny, well-informed, and a pleasure to spend a couple hours with while walking around Toronto. The quality of the food in the restaurants he chose was outstanding.

reviews.title: Toronto's amazing food experience
text: Very happy we did this tour! You will step into restaurants you would never choose yourself and will be surprised by very very very delicious bites from divers kitchens! The guide gives historical information about the city and neighbourhoods and of course about the great restaurants and food Toronto has to offer. Must do in Toronto!

reviews.title: Great tour!
text: Julie was our guide and she did an outstanding job. We not only visited some very interesting restaurants, but we learned a great deal about the history and culture of Toronto. The food samples were tasty and were from diverse cultures.. The walk took us through a lot of early Toronto history. Julia said she had only been doing the tours for about 6  months, but she clearly knows the area, the vendors and the market area.
We've been on food tours all over the world, from Italy to Japan to England and this is clearly one the best.

reviews.title: Fantastic Food
text: All seven sites were places we wouldn't have found on our own and all offered excellent food.  Well worth the time and money.

reviews.title: Fun day
text: Alex was a true foodie and knows the area well.  Good variety of foods.  Enough history to keep it interesting.

reviews.title: Great food tour
text: This was our first food tour and Joseph did not let us down, the food we sampled was diverse with many different cultural tastes.  The tour was super interesting learning about how this part of Toronto has developed historically with the changing communities and the art work was amazing.

reviews.title: Visitor
text: Greatly enjoyed this tour! Not only did we get to taste amazing food and experience a variety of different culture’s foods, Alex was so knowledgeable about the history of Toronto! His engaging stories of both the families of the restaurants that we visited, and just general history of how Chinatown and surrounding neighborhoods began, allowed us to experience the sights, sounds, aromas, and flavors of  Toronto.

reviews.title: Food Tour - Kensington & Chinatown
text: Looking for things to do in Toronto and decided to try this as a girls day out.
Had a wonderful guide and loved the different food experiences.
Great for people of all ages. Easy pace.
Highly Recommend!!

reviews.title: Awesome experience
text: I really recommend this tour. It is a great way to experience the area and sample some awesome food you wouldn't otherwise think or know about. During the walk our guide gave us a mini history lesson which made the experience even more interesting. It is a great way to start the day and then spend the rest of the day in the area at your own pace. Our tour guy was friendly and knowledgeable. You definitely gets your money's worth!!

reviews.title: Getting to know the west end
text: I took my husband on the tour for his birthday. As Beach residents, we’re not as familiar with the west end. The tour guide was very friendly and knowledgeable, and with our smaller group, it felt like we were just out with a group of friends. Food was amazing at every stop.

reviews.title: Informative and food filled fun!
text: Loved this tour! Lots of neighborhood cultural insights and delicious goodies! It was super fun and our tour was the perfect amount of time and stops. All of the food choices were varied and a great representation of the toronto food scene!

reviews.title: Fun time
text: We had a great time learning about Toronto’s history and eating great food. Our guide Joseph was friendly and knowledgeable.  This was our first food tour, and we really enjoyed it. It’s great to learn history while having great nosh.   I definitely recommend this tour.

reviews.title: Large family had a great day
text: 12 of us 8-50 did the Kensington tour with Julia. Some of us from toronto and some visiting from the US. We had a great day. Lots of very interesting toronto facts and so much good food. I’ve done a Kensington food tour before but this one seemed more authentically cultural. Highly recommend.

reviews.title: Delicious and Informative Food Tour
text: I visited Toronto for the first time this summer and decided to book a food tour after hearing about the city's amazing food scene. The tour guide started with a nice icebreaker for the group. She kept the tour informative and interesting, sharing the history of each neighborhood along with details about the restaurants we visited. Everything was absolutely delicious and my dietary restrictions were easily accommodated. My favorite dish: the soup dumplings.

reviews.title: Come hungry!
text: A fun, interesting way to explore Chinatown & Kensington Market. 7 varied stops for food punctuated with stories and history about the areas. Alex was an informative guide and a great ambassador for Toronto. We thoroughly enjoyed our tour.

reviews.title: Excellent Tour
text: You will be so full on food and culture. We had an awesome tour with Alex. All of the food stops were excellent and unique. Alex is very personable and had great energy. The Dan Dan noodles cannot be beat. Highly recommend this tour!!

reviews.title: Excellent food tour
text: I live in Toronto and visit Kensington Market occasionally. This tour took me places I never noticed and introduced me to new types of food. Julia was a great guide and was very knowledgeable about the history of Toronto. I really enjoyed my afternoon and will recommend this tour to my friends.

reviews.title: Good food and learned a lot of history
text: Julia was an amazing host and tour guide. Knowledgeable and easy to understand. Weather was cold but Julia pulled us inside frequently to keep us warm. Thanks Julia.

reviews.title: Lots of hidden gems with Julia
text: Thank you so much Julia for a great experience around Chinatown and Kensington market. If we didn’t do this tour and know the background and history to do with the market we wouldn’t have even thought it was a market. We just arrived the live in Toronto and will definitely be going back. Julia took us on a real culture behind the scenes of the locals tour! Delicious food too - the noodles and fish and chips were are favourite! Thank you so much for a great intro to the market and local neighborhood.

reviews.title: Fun, Knowledgeable, and YUM
text: My husband and I had a fantastic time on this food tour. Both our tour guide and tour guide in training were extremely knowledgeable about the food and the history of Kensington market and Chinatown. We really enjoyed the food and the experience of being able to walk around and just get a vibe foe the culture! Would totally recommend it!

reviews.title: Great experience and bang for your buck!!
text: Had a great tour with my guide Alex, ended up being a small group due to the time and weather, but I'd do it again in a heartbeat and recommend to anyone traveling to the area to get a "taste" of the city!

reviews.title: Our guide and the food were awesome!
text: We started our friends' bach trip at Toronto with this food tour and it was the best choice! We went hungry, which was a huge plus because there was SO much to eat...we all couldn't breathe by the end of the tour because we were so full.  Walking from one restaurant to another wasn't dreadful at all cause our guide had fun facts to share during the walk and spaced out each portion well so our stomachs weren't overwhelmed.  We really got to experience the culture and glad we got to meet new people, as well.

reviews.title: Best part of our trip to Toronto!
text: On our trip to Toronto with three teenage daughters, we enjoyed seeing all the sights, but our food tour of Kensington Market and Chinatown was the absolute favorite!  We loved how tastes of different delicious foods was interspersed with walking to various areas and learning their history!

reviews.title: Had a wonderful time!
text: Our group had a fantastic time, despite the rainy day. Highly recommend, for locals and visitors alike!

reviews.title: Great way to spend the morning!
text: We had time before the afternoon Blue Jay game and signed up for the tour. Everything was well organized and we learned so many interesting facts about the area. All the food samplings were great.  Would definitely recommend.

reviews.title: Fun Day
text: This was a really fun afternoon. There were lots of interesting stops, some where we never would have found on our own. ALL the food was great.

reviews.title: Amazing food and new friends!
text: This tour was totally worth the money. I was full after the first stop. Ha ha! The tour guide was great, super friendly and knowledgeable. Every experience was delicious.
